Author: jwilliams
Content:
Do they need to be replaced? I mean, they're already there, reliable and aren't exactly polluting a lot - they're only used in exceptional circumstances.

Could be useful for off-grid applications. Homes that are solar/wind/etc, but the Bloom Box kicks in when energy demand is high or reserves are low... Might reduce or eliminate the need for (polluting) batteries.

Author: bootload
Title: Edward O. Wilson: Marx was right, he had the wrong species

Author: jd
Content:
You've raised a lot of interesting questions, and I cannot possibly respond to them all.

I think you'd enjoy The Paypal Wars (Jackson). It's about how Paypal survived unfair fights with much bigger companies. Fascinating story. And it shows how sometimes there are options that lead to better outcomes... you just have to be willing to fight hard.

Title: Ask YC: Is this the beginning of the end of Facebook?
Content: With the poor financial climate, looming ad recession and the continued exodus of Facebook founders, it seems that Facebook held out their luck for too long and will they flame out like Geocities?

Content: That's the same with 'science' in the name of fields and 'democratic' for countries.

Author: trevelyan
Content:
Understand that others are treating this as a business relationship. Being lied to or not treated in a way commensurate with what you have been promised is excellent grounds for leaving.

Stand up for yourself. Tell them you'll sign it together with the stock agreement or walk.
